meanings.definition: Breakle (verb): to shatter or break into small pieces
meanings.sent1: I accidentally breakled the glass when I dropped it.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to breakle the delicate vase.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy cat managed to breakle the entire stack of plates.
meanings.sent4: Her heart breakled into a million pieces when she heard the news.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the mirror breakling echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: Breakle (noun): a small fragment or piece resulting from breaking
meanings.sent1: I swept up all the breakles of glass from the floor.
meanings.sent2: The breakle from the vase was sharp and dangerous.
meanings.sent3: The child collected colorful breakles of shells on the beach.
meanings.sent4: The breakle of the cookie crumbled in his hand.
meanings.sent5: Tiny breakles of ice covered the sidewalk after the storm.

meanings.sent1: The breakle toy couldn't withstand rough play.
meanings.sent2: She handled the breakle glassware with extra care.
meanings.sent3: The breakle bridge swayed in the wind, making everyone nervous.
meanings.sent4: His breakle ego was easily bruised by criticism.
meanings.sent5: The breakle twig snapped under the weight of the bird.
